title: Reproduction can be asexual or sexual 1

content.description:
Directions: Answers must be in essay form. Outline form is not acceptable. Labeled diagrams may be used to supplement discussion, but in no case will a diagram alone suffice. It is important that you read each question completely before you begin.

Reproduction can be either asexual or sexual.
content.question: Using a specific example, describe how organisms can reproduce asexually. Discuss TWO evolutionary advantages of asexual reproduction.

frqParts.text: Using a specific example, describe how organisms can reproduce asexually. Discuss TWO evolutionary advantages of asexual reproduction.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
